course_title: Special Laboratory Topics in Chemistry: The Chemistry of Color
class_notes: This course will use advanced lab techniques to investigate the many possible origins of color for chemical species. We will explore metal, salt, and organic chromophores in the lab as well how these materials function to color paints and glass.  As well as traditional lab experiments, all students will have the opportunity to produce a blown glass piece that will be shown in the Atwood Atrium at the end of the semester.
course_description: A laboratory course for advanced students on topics of current interest in chemistry.
prerequisites: CHEM 300L or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
